term.title: lone (electron) pair

item.text: Two paired electrons localized in the valence shell on a single atom. Lone pairs should be designated with two dots. The term 'nonbonding electron pair' is more appropriate, and is found in many modern text books.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1137 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)
